title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.14.39 - 41 | 21-11-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadhadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing
from three verses 39, 40 and 41
of the 14th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
The 39th verse
Kachitte Anamayam Tata
Bhrashta Teja Vibhasime
Alabdha Mano Avagyataha
Kimbatata Chiroshitaha
This is another verse spoken by Krishna to Arjuna
Krishna
This is a verse spoken by Yudhishthira to Arjuna
Yudhishthira is addressing Arjuna
My dear brother Arjuna
Please tell me whether your health is all right?
You appear to have lost your bodily lust.
Is this due to others disrespecting and neglecting you because of your long stay at Dwaraka?
This is a question raised by Yudhishthira.
See in the purport, Srila Prabhupada says,
From all angles of vision, Maharaj Yudhishthira inquired from Arjuna about the welfare of Dwaraka,
but he concluded at last that as long as Lord Sri Krishna himself was there, nothing inauspicious
could happen.
But at the same time, Arjuna appeared to be bereft of his bodily lust.
And thus, the king inquired of his personal welfare and asked so many vital questions.
This is a question raised by Yudhishthira to Arjuna.
This is a question raised by Yudhishthira to Arjuna.
This is a question raised by Yudhishthira to Arjuna.
This is a question raised by Yudhishthira to Arjuna.
He replied to this in sweet lijana- intxitora,
Kaccinna abihito abihinga abhavaihi And has received an shakti from a spiritual
mind that happens within him.
The meaning of these verses…
Has someone addressed you with unfriendly words?
or threatened you could you not give charity to one who asked or could you
not keep your promise to someone these are all different reasons why a
respectable personality becomes very depressed or dejected or very unhappy so
Yudhishthira is trying to find out what is the cause for Arjuna's dejection so in
the parapotra la prapa says a kshatriya or a rich man is sometimes visited by
persons who are in need of money when they are asked for a donation it is a
duty of the possessor of wealth to given charity in consideration of the person
place and time if a kshatriya or a rich man
nd
and fails to comply with this obligation, he must be very sorry for this discrepancy.
Similarly, one should not fail to keep his promise to give in charity.
These discrepancies are sometimes causes of despondency and thus failing a person becomes
subjected to criticism which might also be the cause of Arjuna's plight, Yudhishthira
is trying to guess.
So one should never go back on one's promise made to somebody to give charity, that is
a very culture.
And if somebody does default then there is such a problem.
The person is subject to criticism.
So Arjuna is being questioned by Yudhishthira, did you undergo any humiliation like that.
The 41st verse, kachit tvam bramanam balam gaam vriddham roginam striyam sharanopasrtham
sattvam na atyakshi sharanapradah.
Shri.
The meaning of this verse is you are always the protector of the deserving living beings
such as brahmanas, children, cows, women and the diseased.
Shri.
Five categories of personalities are mentioned here who deserve protection.
Who are they?
The brahmanas, the children, the cows, the women and the diseased people.
So the question being raised, could you not give them protection when they approached
you for shelter?
Shri.
Yes.
Shri.
In the purport Srila Prabhupada says, the brahmanas who are always engaged in researching
knowledge for the society's welfare work both materially and spiritually deserve the
protection of the king in all respects.
What is the position of a brahmana?
Prabhupada is explaining.
Why these five categories are singled out for specifically for the protection of the
king?
Shri.
To be given protection, to be given protection by the king, why?
So it is one by one Prabhupada will explain.
The brahmanas they are always engaged in society's welfare work and what kind of welfare activity
they perform, they are researching knowledge for society's welfare.
They are conversant with the Vedas.
And therefore they apply the Vedic principles and teach us.
So such brahmanas have to be protected by the king.
Similarly the children of the state, the cow, the diseased person, the woman and the old
man specifically require the protection of the state or a chatriya king.
Shri.
They have to be given special protection, not the ordinary one.
If such living beings do not get protection by the chatriya or the royal order or by the
state, it is certainly shameful for the chatriya or the state.
So they deserve to get protection and the king should be giving them protection.
Then only there will be prosperity and peace in the state, at the state level.
If such things had actually happened to Arjuna, Maharaja Yudhishthira was anxious to know about
these discrepancies.
So these were the different questions raised by Yudhishthira in questioning Arjuna.
What is the cause of Arjuna's dejection, unprecedented?
So different ways he is questioning just to ascertain that.
Shri.
Is it really true that Krishna has departed to his personal labor, has left the earth
planet?
Is it true?
That is what Yudhishthira is trying to ascertain.
And before he concludes anything, he is trying to pacify.
Shri.
Yes.
Shri.
And wants to ascertain the actual facts of the case.
So the society was a very evolved society.
It was not that people were living in an uncivilized way or primitive way.
No.
It was a highly cultured society.
The indications are very clear here.
If a great personality is disrespected, then it is a cause for great concern because the
society was very very well organized and people were properly trained how to respect great
personalities.
And it was meticulously followed by everyone.
The society was an evolved society.
So therefore Arjuna appears to have lost his bodily luster.
We do not know what is bodily luster in Kali Yuga.
Such bodily luster is seen in persons who have got the strength of God's grace.
Shri.
Yes.
Shri.
Yes.
The strength of doing some tapasya, some voluntary penance and then they develop a
certain spiritual bodily luster.
Such luster is not seen among ordinary people or even externally intelligent, materially
intelligent people.
You cannot see such luster.
It is only to be seen in transcendentalists.
And.
Yes.
It is also said here that Arjuna is such a great personality but somebody threatens
Arjuna or addresses him with unfriendly words, that is a cause of great concern.
Even though Arjuna is powerful, he does not want to utilize his power for some ordinary
purposes.
Yes.
Yes.
So therefore the questions are being raised to find out whether Arjuna's cause of dejection
is something that happened while Arjuna was returning home in Hastinapura from Dwarka.
Did somebody threaten you?
Yes.
Yes.
Yes.
Did they address you with unfriendly words?
That means in the very culture, people greet each other in a very respectable way because
the culture is very advanced.
Whereas if somebody is not showing the proper due respect for another person, the society
becomes gradually degraded so you will go to degradation and loss of such values means people
cannot properly practice spiritual life spiritual life is always on a foundation of values you just
can't make a show of some ritual and become a spiritually advanced person that never works
so all the part of us all the devotees they are always transiently situated
which means they are untouched by they Suри energy so therefore they
they can actually live in the society
in a dignified way otherwise it becomes very difficult for civilized people to
interact with others who may not be civilized so therefore in the former
times the society was properly divided and people used to follow the principles
very strictly and therefore the culture was very very advanced that is what is
explained in the scriptures so I'll stop here thank you very much Hare Krishna
